basics.name: Milan Bukovics
basics.label: Electrical Engineering Graduate Student
basics.summary: M.S. Electrical Engineering candidate and Division I student-athlete specializing in robotics, embedded systems, and AI/ML. Experienced in ROS 2 perception and control, custom PCB systems, sensor fusion, and reinforcement-learning-based controllers. Strong background in hardware–software co-design and rapid prototyping.

education.summary: 3.6 GPA; 6× Dean’s List; multiple scholarships and academic awards.

volunteer.organization: University of Hawai‘i Swim & Dive Team
volunteer.summary: Division I athlete competing in collegiate and international swimming.
highlights: Led a 50-member Division I swim team across two seasons, fostering discipline, teamwork, and accountability.
Division I Conference Champion; 2× European Junior and 2019 World Junior Championships for Hungary.
Balanced elite athletics with full engineering course load, demonstrating resilience and time management.
Awards: Academic All-American, Big West Commissioner’s Honor Roll-Highest Honors, 2× Athlete of the Week.

work.summary: Developing an AI-powered swim-training platform integrating workout generation, data analytics, and athlete readiness reports.
highlights: Built cross-platform application in Flutter/Dart with Firebase backend.
Implemented OpenAI-powered personalized workout engine and analytics pipeline.
Designed embedded sensor workflows for real-time performance tracking.

work.summary: Supported system design and validation tasks for commercial electrical infrastructure.
highlights: Reviewed electrical schematics and load schedules for facility systems.
Assisted with system commissioning, site inspections, and documentation.
Collaborated with engineers on troubleshooting and equipment validation.

work.summary: TA for Verilog HDL, FPGA prototyping, and digital logic design.
highlights: Taught 50+ students Verilog, testbenches, and logic simulation.
Led lab modules on finite-state machines and hardware timing.
Supported students with FPGA synthesis on Xilinx platforms.

work.summary: Delivered high-quality service and logistical support at large university and private events.
highlights: Bartended and served at high-volume athletic and corporate events.
Handled catering logistics, setup, and event coordination.
Maintained excellent customer service in fast-paced environments.
